newsitem.title: PHILIPPINES: Fire burns down 120 houses in southern Philippines.
newsitem.headline: Fire burns down 120 houses in southern Philippines.

text.p: About 120 houses were razed to the ground when fire spread through a densely populated area of a southern Philippine town, according to reports reaching the military headquarters on Saturday.
Armed forces' Southern Command spokesman Fredesvindo Covarrubias said the military was still investigating the cause of the fire which killed a six-year old boy and injured two others.
The fire hit Siasi town in Sulu, about 940 km (580 miles) south of Manila, early on Friday morning.
The displaced families have been relocated in public school buildings.
In April 1994, suspected Moslem rebels set a town centre in the southern Philippines ablaze killing more than 50 people.
